author: Timothy Linward
description:
Japanese Pokémon TCG players have gotten their hands on the latest set, Black Bolt White Flair, and have been sharing the spoils on social media. It’s the first chance for Western fans to get a glimpse at the Secret Illustration Rares in the set, and there’s a lot to look forward to when it gets an English language release, starting with a truly gorgeous Reshiram ex.

Continue reading Killer Reshiram ex heads up Pokémon TCG's newest Secret Illustration Rares
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Pokémon cards, Rare Pokémon cards, All Pokémon sets in order
title: Killer Reshiram ex heads up Pokémon TCG's newest Secret Illustration Rares

author: Matt Bassil
description:
The MTG card Sage of Hours has seen a pretty sizable price spike, doubling in cost over the past few weeks. On May 15, the card was priced at just $4.20, according to MTG Goldfish, and now it’s up to $9.40.

Continue reading MTG card that can chain extra turns forever doubles in price
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order, Upcoming MTG release dates, How to play MTG
title: MTG card that can chain extra turns forever doubles in price

author: Mollie Russell
description:
Tales of the Valiant, the Kobold Press spin-off from 2014's Dungeons and Dragons rules, released its debut starter set at the end of May. Packed with glossy maps, monster tokens, and Steamforged Games' own character minis, the set makes a flashier first impression than any D&D boxed set has done to date. Unfortunately, there's a big 'style over substance' problem going on underneath the surface - one that perhaps doesn't do the core Tales of the Valiant rules adequate justice.

Below I've detailed my experiences testing a copy of Tales of the Valiant's starter set kindly provided by Steamforged Games. A thorough read-through and multiple games at various levels have helped me generate these personal opinions on the product.

Continue reading Tales of the Valiant starter set makes the RPG seem 10 years behind DnD
MORE FROM WARGAM
title: Tales of the Valiant starter set makes the RPG seem 10 years behind DnD

author: Timothy Linward
description:
Games Workshop has played a massive role shaping the market for hobby paints, with the massive success of Warhammer 40k creating a market for paints with different colors and properties from those favored by military modelling or Gunpla hobbyists. Games Workshop has often been at the forefront of innovating new paint formulas, but having tested several new paint ranges at this year’s UK Games Expo, it’s clear to me that it’s being left behind.

Continue reading Games Workshop's Warhammer paints are being thrashed by crafty competitors
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Warhammer 40k starter sets, Best Warhammer 40k games, All Warhammer 40k factions
title: Games Workshop's Warhammer paints are being thrashed by crafty competitors

author: Timothy Linward
description:
The DnD Monk 5e class is defined by its mobility and discipline. These martial arts masters power their superhuman agility with Focus Points, a resource that turns them into dexterous fighting machines. Few classes can match the speed and strike frequency of a Dungeons and Dragons Monk, but they’re not quite so complicated to play, either. This guide explains how the 5e Monk class works, with plenty of tips on building one.

Continue reading DnD Monk 5e class guide
MORE FROM WARGAMER: DnD 2024 Player's Handbook review, DnD classes guide, DnD races guide
title: DnD Monk 5e class guide

author: Alex Evans
description:
As a lifelong Star Wars lover and wargamer, I hyperventilated a little bit when Days of Wonder announced it was turning Memoir ‘44 - one of the most popular war board games ever to hit a table - into Star Wars: Battle of Hoth, a proper tactical wargame about The Empire Strikes Back’s iconic opening barney. Well, now I’ve played it - and I have two main takeaways: it’s unsurprising, and it’s excellent.

Continue reading Star Wars: Battle of Hoth preview - just the 'Empire' wargame I was looking for
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Star Wars board games, Best strategy board games, Best board games
title: Star Wars: Battle of Hoth preview - just the 'Empire' wargame I was looking for

author: Matt Bassil
description:
Recently, I had the chance to try out the upcoming League of Legends trading card game, Riftbound. A physical, collectible TCG sold in booster packs, it marks an interesting new avenue for Riot Games. Riftbound has many similarities to other TCGs - most notably Magic: The Gathering. But it really shines in the areas where it chooses to differ.

In an interview with the game’s director, Dave Guskin, he explained that the ethos of the game was to foster explosive “moments of power”. The player has to choose the perfect time to pop off, like firing off your ultimate in League of Legends.

Continue reading League of Legends TCG Riftbound warps the MTG formula in all the right ways
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order,
title: League of Legends TCG Riftbound warps the MTG formula in all the right ways

author: Timothy Linward
description:
I had the luck to briefly test Lost Lumina, an upcoming board game from Dranda Games, at the UK Games Expo, and the experience left me eager for more. With a tiny board, a handful of meeples, and a grip of combat cards, it scratched the same itch for me as strategy epics like Game of Thrones or Dune, despite games playing out in ten to twenty minutes.

Continue reading First look at Lost Lumina, a tiny board game with Game of Thrones level combat
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best board games , Couples' board games, Board games for adults
title: First look at Lost Lumina, a tiny board game with Game of Thrones level combat
